I don’t think Bitcoin will ever be used for institutional payments (corporates send them out in trillions) but individuals will continue to use Bitcoin for payments. I will, anyway.
Ripple is a private company. XRP is a cryptocurrency and a digital asset. All cryptocurrencies are digital assets. https://tiffanyhayden.blog/2018/03/28/xrp-is-a-cryptocurrency/ …

So, keep in mind that I’m an outsider and this is just my perspective. Banks, along with every type of payment provider, are encouraged to join RippleNet for access to liquidity. Banks don’t have to know if XRP was used by a market maker. Some banks will become market makers.
Ripple has shareholders. Investors have shares of Ripple stock.
What is Ripple?https://xrpcommunity.blog/what-is-ripple/

I don’t think I understand you. I definitely agree that if people don’t like the way Bitcoin or XRP is being distributed that they should find something more to their liking. There are no shortages of choices, lol.
David’s point, I think, is that Satoshi created Bitcoin and he/she/they were perfectly entitled to decide how it would be distributed. Just like with Ripple. You create it, it’s yours.
Of course anyone can become a Gateway. It’s an open network. You can do whatever you want. I said RIPPLE moved away from the Gateway model. R-I-P-P-L-E
Ripple moved away from the Gateway model in 2014.

My point is mostly that anyone can create a coin, but not everyone can create value. People think Ripple just “printed” those XRP, unfairly creating money. It’s not unfair if everyone has this option. I created 10 trillion $ FORK tokens after reading a blog. Guess their value?
